bibliographic_metadata.Title: Mineral prospectivity Mapping: An interpretable classifier Combining catchment basin and knowledge graph embedding
bibliographic_metadata.Author: Qun Yan, Yao Pei, Linfu Xue, Hairui Sun, Rui Wang, Xiangjin Ran

abstract: This study develops a Mineral Prospectivity Mapping (MPM) method that integrates data and knowledge for geological interpretation. Using stream sediment geochemical assays and a geological map knowledge graph, we construct catchment basins to constrain spatial geochemical interpolation. A Graph Attention Network (GAT) embeds geological knowledge, and K-means clustering classifies samples for training an XGBoost model for gold prospectivity prediction. Results show improved prediction performance, with key elements associated with gold mineralization identified.

dataset_fields.scope: Gold prospectivity prediction in the Mawu area, Gansu Province

key_points: Integration of geological knowledge with geochemical data enhances prediction accuracy.
K-means clustering effectively classifies spatial features for sample selection.
XGBoost model provides interpretable results using Shapley values.
Geochemical interpolation constrained by catchment basins improves spatial alignment with geological features.
Five gold mineral prospectivity areas were delineated based on the model.
